intro: Erigeron transsilvanicus, commonly known as Transylvanian fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Europe, particularly found in grasslands and rocky areas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which bloom in late summer to early autumn, are white to pale blue and attract various pollinators. Erigeron transsilvanicus is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its adaptability and role in supporting local biodiversity.
